Class OpticalProperties

Namespace
Vts
Assembly
Vts.dll

Describes optical properties needed as input for various forward solver models. Namespace contains the main classes

[DataContract]
public class OpticalProperties : BindableObject, INotifyPropertyChangedPlus, INotifyPropertyChanged

Constructors

OpticalProperties()

Creates optical properties with values 0.01, 1.0, 0.8, 1.4 for mua, musp, g and n respectively

public OpticalProperties()

OpticalProperties(double, double, double, double)

Definition of optical properties

public OpticalProperties(double mua, double musp, double g, double n)

Parameters

mua double

absorption coefficient = probability of absorption per unit distance traveled

musp double

scattering coefficient = probability of having scattered per unit distance traveled

g double

anisotropy coefficient = cosine of an average scattering angle (where the angle is relative to the incoming and outgoing unit direction vectors)

n double

refractive index mismatch

OpticalProperties(double[])

Creates a new instance based on values in an array [mua, musp, g, n]

public OpticalProperties(double[] op)

Parameters

op double[]

optical properties of the medium

OpticalProperties(OpticalProperties)

Creates a new instance based on values from a previous instance

public OpticalProperties(OpticalProperties op)

Parameters

op OpticalProperties

optical properties of the medium

Properties

G

anisotropy coefficient = cosine of an average scattering angle (where the angle is relative to the incoming and outgoing unit direction vectors)

[DataMember]
public double G { get; set; }

Property Value

double

Remarks

Warning - Setting this value also modifies Mus!

Mua

absorption coefficient = probability of absorption per unit distance traveled

[DataMember]
public double Mua { get; set; }

Property Value

double

Mus

scattering coefficient = probability of having scattered per unit distance traveled

[DataMember]
public double Mus { get; set; }

Property Value

double

Remarks

Warning - Setting this value also modifies Musp!

Musp

reduced scattering coefficient = probability of having scattered per unit distance traveled

[DataMember]
public double Musp { get; set; }

Property Value

double

Remarks

Warning - Setting this value also modifies Mus! Warning - This must be defined AFTER Mus and G to deserialize correctly (or alternatively, we should use [IgnoreDataMember] either here or for Mus)

N

refractive index mismatch

[DataMember]
public double N { get; set; }

Property Value

double
